questions.question: Do you believe ..................... ghosts?
questions.description: We use the preposition 'in' after the verb believe.

questions.question: She spent years caring ..................... her sick husband.
questions.description: To care for somebody is to look after them.

questions.question: This spray will protect you ......................... most insects.
questions.description: The verb protect takes the preposition from before an object.

questions.question: He has yet to recover .......................... his illness.
questions.description: The verb recover takes the preposition from before an object.

questions.question: He won the national bravery award for saving his friend ..................... drowning.
questions.description: We use the preposition from after the verb save.

questions.question: He worked hard to succeed ........................ life.
questions.description: Succeed is followed by the preposition 'in'.

questions.question: I don't approve .......................... your conduct, young man.
questions.description: Approve is followed by the preposition of.

questions.question: That shampoo smells ....................... jasmine.
questions.description: Smell is followed by the preposition of.

questions.question: Please don't make a noise. I want to concentrate ................... my studies.
questions.description: Concentrate should be followed by the preposition on.

questions.question: My husband and I can't agree ....................... anything but we love each other.
Please refer ......................... the glossary for more information.
questions.description: Refer is followed by the preposition to.
